summary: "Raging Bull" is a 1980 American movie about boxer Jake LaMotta, directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Robert De Niro. It's based on LaMotta's life story, showing his boxing career and personal struggles with anger and jealousy. De Niro gained 60 pounds for the role. The film received mixed reviews at first but is now considered one of the best movies ever made. It won two Academy Awards and is preserved in the United States National Film Registry.
title: Raging Bull
